00019 static struct os_event *os_current_event = NULL;

00021 void os_event_create(struct os_event *event,
00022         const struct os_event_descriptor *descriptor, os_ptr_t args)
00023 {
00024     // Fill the event structure
00025     event->desc.sort = descriptor->sort;
00026     event->desc.start = descriptor->start;
00027     event->desc.is_triggered = descriptor->is_triggered;
00028     event->args = args;
00029 }

00035 static inline struct os_process *__os_event_pop_process(struct os_event *event) {
00036     struct os_process *proc = event->proc;
00037     event->proc = proc->next;
00038     return proc;
00039 }
00040 
00043 static inline void __os_event_pop(struct os_event *event) {
00044     struct os_event *prev_event = os_current_event;
00045     // If the event is the 1rst one
00046     if (event == os_current_event) {
00047         os_current_event = event->next;
00048     }
00049     else {
00050         // Look for the event in the list
00051         while (prev_event->next != event) {
00052             prev_event = prev_event->next;
00053         }
00054         prev_event->next = event->next;
00055     }
00056 }
00057 
00058 static inline void __os_event_insert_process_after(struct os_process *proc,
00059         struct os_process *new_proc) {
00060     new_proc->next = proc->next;
00061     proc->next = new_proc;
00062 }
00063 
00064 static inline void __os_event_insert_process_begining(struct os_event *event,
00065         struct os_process *proc) {
00066     proc->next = event->proc;
00067     event->proc = proc;
00068 }
00069 
00070 static inline void __os_event_enable(struct os_event *event) {
00071     if (os_current_event) {
00072         event->next = os_current_event->next;
00073     }
00074     else {
00075         event->next = NULL;
00076     }
00077     os_current_event = event;
00078 }
00079 
00080 static inline void __os_event_start(struct os_event *event) {
00081     if (event->desc.start) {
00082         event->desc.start(event->args);
00083     }
00084 }
00085 
00086 static inline bool __os_event_is_triggered(struct os_event *event) {
00087     if (event->desc.is_triggered(os_get_current_process(), event->args)
00088             == OS_EVENT_NONE)
00089         return false;
00090     return true;
00091 }

00099 {
00100     return true;
00101 }

00103 bool os_event_sort_lifo(struct os_process *proc1,
00104         struct os_process *proc2)
00105 {
00106     return false;
00107 }

00109 #if CONFIG_OS_USE_PRIORITY == true
00110 bool os_event_sort_priority(struct os_process *proc1,
00111         struct os_process *proc2)
00112 {
00113     return (proc1->priority <= proc2->priority);
00114 }
00115 #endif

00117 void __os_event_register(struct os_event *event, struct os_process *proc)
00118 {
00119     struct os_event *current_event;
00120     struct os_process *prev_proc = NULL;
00121     struct os_process *current_proc;
00122     bool (*sort_fct)(struct os_process *, struct os_process *);
00123 
00124     // Get the appropriate sorting function
00125 #if CONFIG_OS_USE_PRIORITY == true
00126     sort_fct = os_event_sort_priority;
00127 #else
00128     sort_fct = os_event_sort_fifo;
00129 #endif
00130     if (event->desc.sort) {
00131         sort_fct = event->desc.sort;
00132     }
00133 
00134     // Enable the event process if not done already, before messing up
00135     // with the process context
00136     __os_process_event_enable();
00137 
00138     // Add the process to the event sorted process list
00139     current_proc = event->proc;
00140     while (current_proc && sort_fct(current_proc, proc)) {
00141         prev_proc = current_proc;
00142         current_proc = current_proc->next;
00143     }
00144     // If the process is supposed to be at the beginning of the list
00145     if (prev_proc) {
00146         __os_event_insert_process_after(prev_proc, proc);
00147     }
00148     else {
00149         __os_event_insert_process_begining(event, proc);
00150     }
00151 
00152     // Add this event to the event list if not done already
00153     current_event = os_current_event;
00154     while (current_event != event) {
00155         if (current_event == NULL) {
00156             __os_event_enable(event);
00157             break;
00158         }
00159         current_event = current_event->next;
00160     }
00161 }
00162 
00166 bool os_event_scheduler(void)
00167 {
00168     // Current event to process
00169     struct os_event *event = os_current_event;
00170     struct os_process *proc;
00171     enum os_event_status status;
00172 
00173     // If no event, return
00174     if (!event) {
00175         // Disable the application process
00176         __os_process_event_disable();
00177         return false;
00178     }
00179 
00180     // Loop through the event list
00181     do {
00182         do {
00183             // Check if the event has been triggered
00184             status = event->desc.is_triggered(event->proc,
00185                     event->args);
00186             if (status != OS_EVENT_NONE) {
00187                 os_enter_critical();
00188                 // Remove the process from the event list
00189                 proc = __os_event_pop_process(event);
00190                 // If this is the last process, remove the event
00191                 // from the list
00192                 if (!proc->next) {
00193                     status = OS_EVENT_OK_STOP;
00194                     __os_event_pop(event);
00195                 }
00196                 // Activate the process
00197                 __os_process_enable(proc);
00198                 os_leave_critical();
00199             }
00200         } while (status == OS_EVENT_OK_CONTINUE);
00201         // Next event
00202         event = event->next;
00203     } while (event);
00204 
00205     // There is at least 1 event in the queue
00206     return true;
00207 }

00209 struct __os_event_custom_function_args {
00210     bool (*trigger)(os_ptr_t);
00211     os_ptr_t args;
00212 };
00213 
00214 enum os_event_status __os_event_custom_function_handler(struct os_process *proc,
00215         os_ptr_t args);
00216 enum os_event_status __os_event_custom_function_handler(struct os_process *proc,
00217         os_ptr_t args)
00218 {
00219     struct __os_event_custom_function_args *custom_args =
00220             (struct __os_event_custom_function_args *) args;
00221     if (custom_args->trigger(custom_args->args))
00222         return OS_EVENT_OK_CONTINUE;
00223     return OS_EVENT_NONE;
00224 }

00226 void os_event_create_from_function(struct os_event *event,
00227         bool (*trigger)(os_ptr_t), os_ptr_t args)
00228 {
00229     const struct os_event_descriptor descriptor = {
00230         .is_triggered = __os_event_custom_function_handler
00231     };
00232     struct __os_event_custom_function_args custom_args = {
00233         .trigger = trigger,
00234         .args = args
00235     };
00236     os_event_create(event, &descriptor, (os_ptr_t) &custom_args);
00237 }

00243 struct os_process os_event_alternate_proc = {
00244     .next = NULL
00245 };

00247 #if CONFIG_OS_USE_SW_INTERRUPTS == true
00248 void os_interrupt_trigger_on_event(struct os_interrupt *interrupt,
00249         struct os_event *event)
00250 {
00251     os_enter_critical();
00252     __os_event_start(event);
00253     __os_event_register(event, os_interrupt_get_process(interrupt));
00254     os_leave_critical();
00255 }

00257 
00258 void os_task_sleep(struct os_task *task, struct os_event *event)
00259 {
00260     extern struct os_process *os_current_process;
00261 
00262     // Start the event
00263     __os_event_start(event);
00264 
00265     // Check if the event is already triggered, if not register the event
00266     // Doing this does not handle priority if (!__os_event_is_triggered(event)) {
00267         os_enter_critical();
00268         // If the task is enabled, send it to sleep
00269         if (os_task_is_enabled(task)) {
00270             __os_process_disable(os_task_get_process(task));
00271         }
00272         // Save the next current task pointer because it will be erase
00273         // by the sleep operation
00274         os_event_alternate_proc.next = os_current_process->next;
00275         // Associate the task with its event and start it
00276         __os_event_register(event, os_task_get_process(task));
00277         // Call the scheduler
00278         os_switch_context(false);
00279         os_leave_critical();
00280 //  }
00281 }
